   21: %%%-------------------------------------------------------------------
   22: %%% File    : signal_SUITE.erl
   23: %%% Author  : Rickard Green <rickard.s.green@ericsson.com>
   24: %%% Description : Test signals
   25: %%%
   26: %%% Created : 10 Jul 2006 by Rickard Green <rickard.s.green@ericsson.com>
   27: %%%-------------------------------------------------------------------
   28: -module(signal_SUITE).
   29: -author('rickard.s.green@ericsson.com').
   30: 
   31: %-define(line_trace, 1).
   32: -include_lib("common_test/include/ct.hrl").
   33: -export([all/0, suite/0,init_per_suite/1, end_per_suite/1]).
   34: -export([init_per_testcase/2, end_per_testcase/2]).
   35: -export([groups/0, init_per_group/2, end_per_group/2]).
   36: 
   37: % Test cases
   38: -export([xm_sig_order/1,
   39:          kill2killed/1,
   40:          contended_signal_handling/1,
   41:          dirty_signal_handling_race/1,
   42:          busy_dist_exit_signal/1,
   43:          busy_dist_demonitor_signal/1,
   44:          busy_dist_down_signal/1,
   45:          busy_dist_spawn_reply_signal/1,
   46:          busy_dist_unlink_ack_signal/1,
   47:          unlink_exit/1,
   48:          monitor_order/1,
   49:          monitor_named_order_local/1,
   50:          monitor_named_order_remote/1,
   51:          monitor_nodes_order/1,
   52:          move_msgs_off_heap_signal_basic/1,
   53:          move_msgs_off_heap_signal_recv/1,
   54:          move_msgs_off_heap_signal_exit/1,
   55:          move_msgs_off_heap_signal_recv_exit/1,
   56:          copy_literal_area_signal_basic/1,
   57:          copy_literal_area_signal_recv/1,
   58:          copy_literal_area_signal_exit/1,
   59:          copy_literal_area_signal_recv_exit/1,
   60:          simultaneous_signals_basic/1,
   61:          simultaneous_signals_recv/1,
   62:          simultaneous_signals_exit/1,
   63:          simultaneous_signals_recv_exit/1]).
   64: 
   65: -export([spawn_spammers/3]).
   66: 
   67: init_per_testcase(Func, Config) when is_atom(Func), is_list(Config) ->
   68:     [{testcase, Func}|Config].
   69: 
   70: end_per_testcase(_Func, Config) ->
   71:     erts_test_utils:ept_check_leaked_nodes(Config).
   72: 
   73: init_per_suite(Config) ->
   74:     Config.
   75: 
   76: end_per_suite(_Config) ->
   77:     ok.
   78: 
   79: suite() ->
   80:     [{ct_hooks,[ts_install_cth]},
   81:      {timetrap, {minutes, 2}}].
   82: 
   83: all() -> 
   84:     [xm_sig_order,
   85:      kill2killed,
   86:      contended_signal_handling,
   87:      dirty_signal_handling_race,
   88:      busy_dist_exit_signal,
   89:      busy_dist_demonitor_signal,
   90:      busy_dist_down_signal,
   91:      busy_dist_spawn_reply_signal,
   92:      busy_dist_unlink_ack_signal,
   93:      unlink_exit,
   94:      monitor_order,
   95:      monitor_named_order_local,
   96:      monitor_named_order_remote,
   97:      monitor_nodes_order,
   98:      {group, adjust_message_queue}].
   99: 
  100: groups() ->
  101:     [{adjust_message_queue, [],
  102:       [move_msgs_off_heap_signal_basic,
  103:        move_msgs_off_heap_signal_recv,
  104:        move_msgs_off_heap_signal_exit,
  105:        move_msgs_off_heap_signal_recv_exit,
  106:        copy_literal_area_signal_basic,
  107:        copy_literal_area_signal_recv,
  108:        copy_literal_area_signal_exit,
  109:        copy_literal_area_signal_recv_exit,
  110:        simultaneous_signals_basic,
  111:        simultaneous_signals_recv,
  112:        simultaneous_signals_exit,
  113:        simultaneous_signals_recv_exit]}].
  114: 
  115: init_per_group(_GroupName, Config) ->
  116:     Config.
  117: 
  118: end_per_group(_GroupName, Config) ->
  119:     Config.
  120: 
  121: %% Test that exit signals and messages are received in correct order
  122: xm_sig_order(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  123:     LNode = node(),
  124:     repeat(fun (_) -> xm_sig_order_test(LNode) end, 1000),
  125:     {ok, Peer, RNode} = ?CT_PEER(),
  126:     repeat(fun (_) -> xm_sig_order_test(RNode) end, 1000),
  127:     peer:stop(Peer),
  128:     ok.
  129: 
  130: xm_sig_order_test(Node) ->
  131:     P = spawn(Node, fun () -> xm_sig_order_proc() end),
  132:     M = erlang:monitor(process, P),
  133:     P ! may_reach,
  134:     P ! may_reach,
  135:     P ! may_reach,
  136:     exit(P, good_signal_order),
  137:     P ! may_not_reach,
  138:     P ! may_not_reach,
  139:     P ! may_not_reach,
  140:     receive
  141: 	      {'DOWN', M, process, P, R} ->
  142: 		  good_signal_order = R
  143: 	  end.
  144: 
  145: xm_sig_order_proc() ->
  146:     receive
  147: 	may_not_reach -> exit(bad_signal_order);
  148: 	may_reach -> ok
  149:     after 0 -> erlang:yield()
  150:     end,
  151:     xm_sig_order_proc().
  152: 
  153: kill2killed(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  154:     process_flag(trap_exit, true),
  155:     kill2killed_test(node()),
  156:     {ok, Peer, Node} = ?CT_PEER(),
  157:     kill2killed_test(Node),
  158:     peer:stop(Peer).
  159: 
  160: kill2killed_test(Node) ->
  161:     if Node == node() ->
  162:             io:format("Testing against local node", []);
  163:        true ->
  164:             io:format("Testing against remote node ~p", [Node])
  165:     end,
  166:     check_exit(Node, other_exit2, 1),
  167:     check_exit(Node, other_exit2, 2),
  168:     check_exit(Node, other_exit2, 9),
  169:     check_exit(Node, other_exit2, 10),
  170:     check_exit(Node, exit2, 1),
  171:     check_exit(Node, exit2, 2),
  172:     check_exit(Node, exit2, 9),
  173:     check_exit(Node, exit2, 10),
  174:     check_exit(Node, exit1, 1),
  175:     check_exit(Node, exit1, 2),
  176:     check_exit(Node, exit1, 9),
  177:     check_exit(Node, exit1, 10),
  178:     ok.
  179: 
  180: check_exit(Node, Type, N) ->
  181:     io:format("Testing ~p length ~p~n", [Type, N]),
  182:     P = spawn_link_line(Node, node(), Type, N, self()),
  183:     if Type == other_exit2 ->
  184:             receive
  185:                 {end_of_line, EOL} ->
  186:                     exit(EOL, kill)
  187:             end;
  188:        true -> ok
  189:     end,
  190:     receive
  191:         {'EXIT', P, Reason} ->
  192:             if Type == exit1 ->
  193:                     kill = Reason;
  194:                true ->
  195:                     killed = Reason
  196:             end
  197:     end.
  198: 
  199: spawn_link_line(_NodeA, _NodeB, other_exit2, 0, Tester) ->
  200:     Tester ! {end_of_line, self()},
  201:     receive after infinity -> ok end;
  202: spawn_link_line(_NodeA, _NodeB, exit1, 0, _Tester) ->
  203:     exit(kill);
  204: spawn_link_line(_NodeA, _NodeB, exit2, 0, _Tester) ->
  205:     exit(self(), kill);
  206: spawn_link_line(NodeA, NodeB, Type, N, Tester) ->
  207:     spawn_link(NodeA,
  208:                fun () ->
  209:                        spawn_link_line(NodeB, NodeA, Type, N-1, Tester),
  210:                        receive after infinity -> ok end
  211:                end).
  212: 
  213: contended_signal_handling(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  214:     %%
  215:     %% Test for a race in signal handling of a process.
  216:     %%
  217:     %% When executing dirty, a "dirty signal handler"
  218:     %% process will handle signals for the process. If
  219:     %% the process stops executing dirty while the dirty
  220:     %% signal handler process is handling signals on
  221:     %% behalf of the process, both the dirty signal handler
  222:     %% process and the process itself might try to handle
  223:     %% signals for the process at the same time. There used
  224:     %% to be a bug that caused both processes to enter the
  225:     %% signal handling code simultaneously when the main
  226:     %% lock of the process was temporarily released during
  227:     %% signal handling (see GH-4885/OTP-17462/PR-4914).
  228:     %% Currently the main lock is only released when the
  229:     %% process receives an 'unlock' signal from a port,
  230:     %% and then responds by sending an 'unlock-ack' signal
  231:     %% to the port. This testcase tries to massage that
  232:     %% scenario. It is quite hard to cause a crash even
  233:     %% when the bug exists, but this testcase at least
  234:     %% sometimes causes a crash when the bug is present.
  235:     %%
  236:     move_dirty_signal_handlers_to_first_scheduler(),
  237:     process_flag(priority, high),
  238:     case erlang:system_info(schedulers_online) of
  239:         1 ->
  240:             ok;
  241:         SOnln -> 
  242:             process_flag(scheduler, SOnln),
  243:             ok
  244:     end,
  245:     Drv = unlink_signal_drv,
  246:     ok = load_driver(Config, Drv),
  247:     try
  248:         contended_signal_handling_test(Drv, 250)
  249:     after
  250:         ok = erl_ddll:unload_driver(Drv)
  251:     end,
  252:     ok.
  253: 
  254: contended_signal_handling_test(_Drv, 0) ->
  255:     ok;
  256: contended_signal_handling_test(Drv, N) ->
  257:     Ports = contended_signal_handling_make_ports(Drv, 100, []),
  258:     erlang:yield(),
  259:     contended_signal_handling_cmd_ports(Ports),
  260:     erts_debug:dirty_cpu(wait, rand:uniform(5)),
  261:     wait_until(fun () -> Ports == Ports -- erlang:ports() end),
  262:     contended_signal_handling_test(Drv, N-1).
  263: 
  264: contended_signal_handling_cmd_ports([]) ->
  265:     ok;
  266: contended_signal_handling_cmd_ports([P|Ps]) ->
  267:     P ! {self(), {command, "c"}},
  268:     contended_signal_handling_cmd_ports(Ps).
  269: 
  270: contended_signal_handling_make_ports(_Drv, 0, Ports) ->
  271:     Ports;
  272: contended_signal_handling_make_ports(Drv, N, Ports) ->
  273:     Port = open_port({spawn, Drv}, []),
  274:     true = is_port(Port),
  275:     contended_signal_handling_make_ports(Drv, N-1, [Port|Ports]).
  276: 
  277: dirty_signal_handling_race(Config) ->
  278:     %% This test case trigger more or less the same
  279:     %% problematic scenario as the contended_signal_handling
  280:     %% test case is trying to trigger. This test case triggers
  281:     %% it via another signal and is also much more likely
  282:     %% (close to 100%) to trigger the problematic schenario.
  283:     Tester = self(),
  284:     move_dirty_signal_handlers_to_first_scheduler(),
  285:     {S0, S1} = case erlang:system_info(schedulers_online) of
  286:                    1 -> {1, 1};
  287:                    2 -> {2, 1};
  288:                    SOnln -> {SOnln, SOnln-1}
  289:                end,
  290:     process_flag(priority, high),
  291:     process_flag(scheduler, S0),
  292:     erts_debug:set_internal_state(available_internal_state, true),
  293:     Drv = unlink_signal_drv,
  294:     ok = load_driver(Config, Drv),
  295:     try
  296:         %% {parallelism, true} option will ensure that each
  297:         %% signal to the port from a process is scheduled which
  298:         %% forces the process to release its main lock when
  299:         %% sending the signal...
  300:         Port = open_port({spawn, Drv}, [{parallelism, true}]),
  301:         true = is_port(Port),
  302:         %% The {alias, reply_demonitor} option will trigger a
  303:         %% 'demonitor' signal from Tester to the port when an
  304:         %% alias message sent using the alias is received by
  305:         %% Tester...
  306:         MA1 = erlang:monitor(port, Port, [{alias, reply_demonitor}]),
  307:         MA2 = erlang:monitor(port, Port, [{alias, reply_demonitor}]),
  308:         Pid = spawn_opt(fun () ->
  309:                                 Tester ! go,
  310:                                 receive after 500 -> ok end,
  311:                                 %% The 'proc_sig_block' test signal will cause
  312:                                 %% dirty signal handling to start and be
  313:                                 %% blocked in the signal handling.
  314:                                 erts_debug:set_internal_state(proc_sig_block,
  315:                                                               {Tester, 1000}),
  316:                                 %% Tester will be stuck waiting for main lock
  317:                                 %% when being scheduled out from its dirty
  318:                                 %% execution. When this alias message is
  319:                                 %% by the dirty signal handler Tester will be
  320:                                 %% able to aquire the main lock and complete
  321:                                 %% the schedule out operation.
  322:                                 MA1 ! {MA1, trigger_demonitor_port_please},
  323:                                 erts_debug:set_internal_state(proc_sig_block,
  324:                                                               {Tester, 100}),
  325:                                 %% Tester will have been selected for
  326:                                 %% execution, but stuck waiting for main lock.
  327:                                 %% When this alias message is handled by the
  328:                                 %% dirty signal handler, Tester will be able
  329:                                 %% to aquire the main lock which will let it
  330:                                 %% enter the problematic scenario. That is,
  331:                                 %% ongoing dirty signal handling while it
  332:                                 %% begins executing.
  333:                                 MA2 ! {MA2, trigger_demonitor_port_please},
  334:                                 erts_debug:set_internal_state(proc_sig_block,
  335:                                                               {Tester, 500}),
  336:                                 ok
  337:                         end, [link, {scheduler, S1}]),
  338:         receive go -> ok end,
  339:         receive {'DOWN', MA1, port, Port, _} -> ct:fail(unexpected_port_down)
  340:         after 0 -> ok
  341:         end,
  342:         receive {'DOWN', MA2, port, Port, _} -> ct:fail(unexpected_port_down)
  343:         after 0 -> ok
  344:         end,
  345:         erts_debug:dirty_cpu(wait, 1000),
  346:         receive
  347:             {MA1, trigger_demonitor_port_please} -> ok
  348:         end,
  349:         receive
  350:             {MA2, trigger_demonitor_port_please} -> ok
  351:         end,
  352:         unlink(Pid),
  353:         unlink(Port),
  354:         exit(Pid, kill),
  355:         exit(Port, kill),
  356:         false = erlang:is_process_alive(Pid)
  357:     after
  358:         ok = erl_ddll:unload_driver(Drv)
  359:     end,
  360:     ok.
  361: 
  362: move_dirty_signal_handlers_to_first_scheduler() ->
  363:     SOnln = erlang:system_flag(schedulers_online, 1),
  364:     try
  365:         true = lists:foldl(
  366:                  fun (Pid, FoundOne) ->
  367:                          case process_info(Pid, initial_call) of
  368:                              {initial_call, {erts_dirty_process_signal_handler,start,0}} ->
  369:                                  Pid ! please_execute_a_bit,
  370:                                  true;
  371:                              _ ->
  372:                                  FoundOne
  373:                          end
  374:                  end,
  375:                  false,
  376:                  processes())
  377:     after
  378:         erlang:system_flag(schedulers_online, SOnln)
  379:     end,
  380:     ok.
  381: 
  382: busy_dist_exit_signal(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  383:     ct:timetrap({seconds, 10}),
  384: 
  385:     BusyTime = 1000,
  386:     {ok, BusyChannelPeer, BusyChannelNode} = ?CT_PEER(),
  387:     {ok, OtherPeer, OtherNode} = ?CT_PEER(["-proto_dist", "gen_tcp"]),
  388:     Tester = self(),
  389:     {Exiter,MRef} = spawn_monitor(BusyChannelNode,
  390:                                   fun () ->
  391:                                           pong = net_adm:ping(OtherNode),
  392:                                           Tester ! {self(), alive},
  393:                                           receive after infinity -> ok end
  394:                                   end),
  395:     receive
  396:         {Exiter, alive} ->
  397:             erlang:demonitor(MRef, [flush]);
  398:         {'DOWN', MRef, process, Why, normal} ->
  399:             ct:fail({exiter_died, Why})
  400:     end,
  401:     Linker = spawn_link(OtherNode,
  402:                         fun () ->
  403:                                 process_flag(trap_exit, true),
  404:                                 link(Exiter),
  405:                                 receive
  406:                                     {'EXIT', Exiter, Reason} ->
  407:                                         tester_killed_me = Reason,
  408:                                         Tester ! {self(), got_exiter_exit_message};
  409:                                     Unexpected ->
  410:                                         exit({unexpected_message, Unexpected})
  411:                                 end
  412:                          end),
  413:     make_busy(BusyChannelNode, OtherNode, BusyTime),
  414:     exit(Exiter, tester_killed_me),
  415:     receive
  416:         {Linker, got_exiter_exit_message} ->
  417:             unlink(Linker),
  418:             ok
  419:     after
  420:         BusyTime*2 ->
  421:             ct:fail(missing_exit_signal)
  422:     end,
  423:     peer:stop(BusyChannelPeer),
  424:     peer:stop(OtherPeer),
  425:     ok.
  426: 
  427: busy_dist_demonitor_signal(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  428:     ct:timetrap({seconds, 10}),
  429: 
  430:     BusyTime = 1000,
  431:     {ok, BusyChannelPeer, BusyChannelNode} = ?CT_PEER(),
  432:     {ok, OtherPeer, OtherNode} = ?CT_PEER(["-proto_dist", "gen_tcp"]),
  433:     Tester = self(),
  434:     Demonitorer = spawn(BusyChannelNode,
  435:                         fun () ->
  436:                                 pong = net_adm:ping(OtherNode),
  437:                                 Tester ! {self(), alive},
  438:                                 receive
  439:                                     {Tester, monitor, Pid} ->
  440:                                         _Mon = erlang:monitor(process, Pid)
  441:                                 end,
  442:                                 receive after infinity -> ok end
  443:                         end),
  444:     receive {Demonitorer, alive} -> ok end,
  445:     Demonitoree = spawn_link(OtherNode,
  446:                              fun () ->
  447:                                      wait_until(fun () ->
  448:                                                         {monitored_by, MB1}
  449:                                                             = process_info(self(),
  450:                                                                            monitored_by),
  451:                                                         lists:member(Demonitorer, MB1)
  452:                                                 end),
  453:                                      Tester ! {self(), monitored},
  454:                                      wait_until(fun () ->
  455:                                                         {monitored_by, MB2}
  456:                                                             = process_info(self(),
  457:                                                                            monitored_by),
  458:                                                         not lists:member(Demonitorer, MB2)
  459:                                                 end),
  460:                                      Tester ! {self(), got_demonitorer_demonitor_signal}
  461:                              end),
  462:     Demonitorer ! {self(), monitor, Demonitoree},
  463:     receive {Demonitoree, monitored} -> ok end,
  464:     make_busy(BusyChannelNode, OtherNode, BusyTime),
  465:     exit(Demonitorer, tester_killed_me),
  466:     receive
  467:         {Demonitoree, got_demonitorer_demonitor_signal} ->
  468:             unlink(Demonitoree),
  469:             ok
  470:     after
  471:         BusyTime*2 ->
  472:             ct:fail(missing_demonitor_signal)
  473:     end,
  474:     peer:stop(BusyChannelPeer),
  475:     peer:stop(OtherPeer),
  476:     ok.
  477: 
  478: busy_dist_down_signal(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  479:     ct:timetrap({seconds, 10}),
  480: 
  481:     BusyTime = 1000,
  482:     {ok, BusyChannelPeer, BusyChannelNode} = ?CT_PEER(),
  483:     {ok, OtherPeer, OtherNode} = ?CT_PEER(["-proto_dist", "gen_tcp"]),
  484:     Tester = self(),
  485:     {Exiter,MRef} = spawn_monitor(BusyChannelNode,
  486:                                   fun () ->
  487:                                           pong = net_adm:ping(OtherNode),
  488:                                           Tester ! {self(), alive},
  489:                                           receive after infinity -> ok end
  490:                                   end),
  491:     receive
  492:         {Exiter, alive} ->
  493:             erlang:demonitor(MRef, [flush]);
  494:         {'DOWN', MRef, process, Why, normal} ->
  495:             ct:fail({exiter_died, Why})
  496:     end,
  497:     Monitorer = spawn_link(OtherNode,
  498:                         fun () ->
  499:                                 process_flag(trap_exit, true),
  500:                                 Mon = erlang:monitor(process, Exiter),
  501:                                 receive
  502:                                     {'DOWN', Mon, process, Exiter, Reason} ->
  503:                                         tester_killed_me = Reason,
  504:                                         Tester ! {self(), got_exiter_down_message};
  505:                                     Unexpected ->
  506:                                         exit({unexpected_message, Unexpected})
  507:                                 end
  508:                          end),
  509:     make_busy(BusyChannelNode, OtherNode, BusyTime),
  510:     exit(Exiter, tester_killed_me),
  511:     receive
  512:         {Monitorer, got_exiter_down_message} ->
  513:             unlink(Monitorer),
  514:             ok
  515:     after
  516:         BusyTime*2 ->
  517:             ct:fail(missing_down_signal)
  518:     end,
  519:     peer:stop(BusyChannelPeer),
  520:     peer:stop(OtherPeer),
  521:     ok.
  522: 
  523: busy_dist_spawn_reply_signal(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  524:     ct:timetrap({seconds, 10}),
  525: 
  526:     BusyTime = 1000,
  527:     {ok, BusyChannelPeer, BusyChannelNode} = ?CT_PEER(),
  528:     {ok, OtherPeer, OtherNode} = ?CT_PEER(["-proto_dist", "gen_tcp"]),
  529:     Tester = self(),
  530:     Spawner = spawn_link(OtherNode,
  531:                          fun () ->
  532:                                  pong = net_adm:ping(BusyChannelNode),
  533:                                  Tester ! {self(), ready},
  534:                                  receive {Tester, go} -> ok end,
  535:                                  ReqID = spawn_request(BusyChannelNode,
  536:                                                        fun () -> ok end,
  537:                                                        []),
  538:                                  receive
  539:                                      {spawn_reply, ReqID, Result, _Pid} ->
  540:                                          ok = Result,
  541:                                          Tester ! {self(), got_spawn_reply_message};
  542:                                      Unexpected ->
  543:                                          exit({unexpected_message, Unexpected})
  544:                                  end
  545:                          end),
  546:     receive {Spawner, ready} -> ok end,
  547:     make_busy(BusyChannelNode, OtherNode, BusyTime),
  548:     Spawner ! {self(), go},
  549:     receive
  550:         {Spawner, got_spawn_reply_message} ->
  551:             unlink(Spawner),
  552:             ok
  553:     after
  554:         BusyTime*2 ->
  555:             ct:fail(missing_spawn_reply_signal)
  556:     end,
  557:     peer:stop(BusyChannelPeer),
  558:     peer:stop(OtherPeer),
  559:     ok.
  560: 
  561: -record(erl_link, {type,           % process | port | dist_process
  562:                    pid = [],
  563:                    state,          % linked | unlinking
  564:                    id}).
  565: 
  566: busy_dist_unlink_ack_signal(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  567:     ct:timetrap({seconds, 10}),
  568: 
  569:     BusyTime = 1000,
  570:     {ok, BusyChannelPeer, BusyChannelNode} = ?CT_PEER(),
  571:     {ok, OtherPeer, OtherNode} = ?CT_PEER(["-proto_dist", "gen_tcp"]),
  572:     Tester = self(),
  573:     {Unlinkee,MRef} = spawn_monitor(BusyChannelNode,
  574:                                     fun () ->
  575:                                             pong = net_adm:ping(OtherNode),
  576:                                             Tester ! {self(), alive},
  577:                                             receive after infinity -> ok end
  578:                                     end),
  579:     receive
  580:         {Unlinkee, alive} ->
  581:             erlang:demonitor(MRef, [flush]);
  582:         {'DOWN', MRef, process, Why, normal} ->
  583:             ct:fail({unlinkee_died, Why})
  584:     end,
  585:     Unlinker = spawn_link(OtherNode,
  586:                           fun () ->
  587:                                   erts_debug:set_internal_state(available_internal_state, true),
  588:                                   link(Unlinkee),
  589:                                   #erl_link{type = dist_process,
  590:                                             pid = Unlinkee,
  591:                                             state = linked} = find_proc_link(self(),
  592:                                                                              Unlinkee),
  593:                                   Tester ! {self(), ready},
  594:                                   receive {Tester, go} -> ok end,
  595:                                   unlink(Unlinkee),
  596:                                   #erl_link{type = dist_process,
  597:                                             pid = Unlinkee,
  598:                                             state = unlinking} = find_proc_link(self(),
  599:                                                                                 Unlinkee),
  600:                                   wait_until(fun () ->
  601:                                                      false == find_proc_link(self(),
  602:                                                                              Unlinkee)
  603:                                              end),
  604:                                   Tester ! {self(), got_unlink_ack_signal}
  605:                           end),
  606:     receive {Unlinker, ready} -> ok end,
  607:     make_busy(BusyChannelNode, OtherNode, BusyTime),
  608:     Unlinker ! {self(), go},
  609:     receive
  610:         {Unlinker, got_unlink_ack_signal} ->
  611:             unlink(Unlinker),
  612:             ok
  613:     after
  614:         BusyTime*2 ->
  615:             ct:fail(missing_unlink_ack_signal)
  616:     end,
  617:     peer:stop(BusyChannelPeer),
  618:     peer:stop(OtherPeer),
  619:     ok.
  620: 
  621: unlink_exit(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  622:     %% OTP-18177
  623:     %%
  624:     %% This bug is theoretically possible, at least in the
  625:     %% node local scenario, but more or less undetectable and
  626:     %% quite harmless when it hits. A process A (the child in
  627:     %% the testcase) could get actual exit reason of another
  628:     %% process B (the parent in the testcase) when it should
  629:     %% have gotten 'noproc' as exit reason. This can happen if
  630:     %% 1. B unlinks A
  631:     %% 2. B begin terminating before it has received an unlink
  632:     %%    ack from A
  633:     %% 3. A links to B after it has received the unlink signal
  634:     %%
  635:     %% This testcase hammers on the above scenario, but I have
  636:     %% not seen it fail yet though when the bug is present...
  637:     repeat(fun unlink_exit_test/0, 1000).
  638: 
  639: unlink_exit_test() ->
  640:     Tester = self(),
  641:     ChildFun =
  642:         fun () ->
  643:                 process_flag(trap_exit, true),
  644:                 Tester ! {child, self()},
  645:                 Parent = receive {tester_parent, Tester, Pid} -> Pid end,
  646:                 Parent ! {go, self()},
  647:                 busy_wait_until(fun () ->
  648:                                         receive {go, Parent} -> true
  649:                                         after 0 -> false
  650:                                         end
  651:                                 end),
  652:                 IsAlive = erlang:is_process_alive(Parent),
  653:                 try
  654:                     link(Parent),
  655:                     case IsAlive of
  656:                         false ->
  657:                             receive
  658:                                 {'EXIT', Parent, noproc} ->
  659:                                     exit(ok);
  660:                                 {'EXIT', Parent, R1} ->
  661:                                     exit({not_alive_unexpected_exit_reason, R1})
  662:                             after 1000 ->
  663:                                     exit(not_alive_missing_exit)
  664:                             end;
  665:                         true ->
  666:                             receive
  667:                                 {'EXIT', Parent, R2} when R2 == noproc;
  668:                                                           R2 == bye ->
  669:                                     exit(ok);
  670:                                 {'EXIT', Parent, R2} ->
  671:                                     exit({alive_unexpected_exit_reason, R2})
  672:                             after 1000 ->
  673:                                     exit(alive_missing_exit)
  674:                             end
  675:                     end
  676:                 catch error:noproc ->
  677:                         receive
  678:                             {'EXIT', Parent, _} = X0 ->
  679:                                 exit({unexpected_exit, X0})
  680:                         after 1000 ->
  681:                                 exit(ok)
  682:                         end
  683:                 end
  684:         end,
  685:     {Parent, PMon} = spawn_opt(fun () ->
  686:                                        %% Work to do when terminating in order
  687:                                        %% to increase the likelyhood of the
  688:                                        %% bug triggering (if present)...
  689:                                        T = ets:new(x,[]),
  690:                                        ets:insert(T, lists:map(fun (I) ->
  691:                                                                        {I,I}
  692:                                                                end,
  693:                                                                lists:seq(1,10000))),
  694: 
  695:                                        Child = spawn_opt(ChildFun,
  696:                                                          [{priority, high},
  697:                                                           link]),
  698:                                        receive {go, Child} -> ok end,
  699:                                        unlink(Child),
  700:                                        Child ! {go, self()},
  701:                                        exit(bye)
  702:                                end, [{priority, high}, monitor]),
  703:     Child = receive {child, Chld} -> Chld end,
  704:     CMon = erlang:monitor(process, Child),
  705:     Child ! {tester_parent, Tester, Parent},
  706:     receive
  707:         {'DOWN', PMon, process, Parent, bye} ->
  708:             ok
  709:     end,
  710:     receive
  711:         {'DOWN', CMon, process, Child, ok} ->
  712:             ok;
  713:         {'DOWN', CMon, process, Child, ChildReason} ->
  714:             ct:fail(ChildReason)
  715:     end.
  716: 
  717: %% Monitors could be reordered relative to message signals when the parallel
  718: %% signal sending optimization was active.
  719: monitor_order(_Config) ->
  720:     process_flag(message_queue_data, off_heap),
  721:     monitor_order_1(10).
  722: 
  723: monitor_order_1(0) ->
  724:     ok;
  725: monitor_order_1(N) ->
  726:     Self = self(),
  727:     {Pid, MRef} = spawn_monitor(fun() ->
  728:                                         receive
  729:                                             MRef ->
  730:                                                 %% The first message sets up
  731:                                                 %% the parallel signal buffer,
  732:                                                 %% the second uses it.
  733:                                                 Self ! {self(), MRef, first},
  734:                                                 Self ! {self(), MRef, second}
  735:                                         end,
  736:                                         exit(normal)
  737:                                 end),
  738:     Pid ! MRef,
  739:     receive
  740:         {'DOWN', MRef, process, _, normal} ->
  741:             ct:fail("Down signal arrived before second message!");
  742:         {Pid, MRef, second} ->
  743:             receive {Pid, MRef, first} -> ok end,
  744:             erlang:demonitor(MRef, [flush]),
  745:             monitor_order_1(N - 1)
  746:     end.
  747: 
  748: %% Signal order: Message vs DOWN from local process monitored by name.
  749: monitor_named_order_local(_Config) ->
  750:     process_flag(message_queue_data, off_heap),
  751:     erts_debug:set_internal_state(available_internal_state, true),
  752:     true = erts_debug:set_internal_state(proc_sig_buffers, true),
  753: 
  754:     LNode = node(),
  755:     repeat(fun (N) -> monitor_named_order(LNode, N) end, 100),
  756:     ok.
  757: 
  758: %% Signal order: Message vs DOWN from remote process monitored by name.
  759: monitor_named_order_remote(_Config) ->
  760:     process_flag(message_queue_data, off_heap),
  761:     erts_debug:set_internal_state(available_internal_state, true),
  762:     true = erts_debug:set_internal_state(proc_sig_buffers, true),
  763: 
  764:     {ok, Peer, RNode} = ?CT_PEER(),
  765:     repeat(fun (N) -> monitor_named_order(RNode, N) end, 10),
  766:     peer:stop(Peer),
  767:     ok.
  768: 
  769: monitor_named_order(Node, N) ->
  770:     %% Send messages using pid, name and alias.
  771:     Pid = self(),
  772:     register(tester, Pid),
  773:     Name = {tester, node()},
  774:     AliasA = alias(),
  775:     NumMsg = 1000 + N,
  776:     Sender = spawn_link(Node,
  777:                      fun() ->
  778:                              register(monitor_named_order, self()),
  779:                              Pid ! {self(), ready},
  780:                              {go, AliasM} = receive_any(),
  781:                              send_msg_seq(Pid, Name, AliasA, AliasM, NumMsg),
  782:                              exit(normal)
  783:                      end),
  784:     {Sender, ready} = receive_any(),
  785:     AliasM = monitor(process, {monitor_named_order,Node},
  786:                      [{alias,explicit_unalias}]),
  787:     Sender ! {go, AliasM},
  788:     recv_msg_seq(NumMsg),
  789:     {'DOWN', AliasM, process, {monitor_named_order,Node}, normal}
  790:         = receive_any(),
  791:     unregister(tester),
  792:     unalias(AliasA),
  793:     unalias(AliasM),
  794:     ok.
  795: 
  796: send_msg_seq(_, _, _, _, 0) -> ok;
  797: send_msg_seq(To1, To2, To3, To4, N) ->
  798:     To1 ! N,
  799:     send_msg_seq(To2, To3, To4, To1, N-1).
  800: 
  801: recv_msg_seq(0) -> ok;
  802: recv_msg_seq(N) ->
  803:     N = receive M -> M end,
  804:     recv_msg_seq(N-1).
  805: 
  806: receive_any() ->
  807:     receive M -> M end.
  808: 
  809: receive_any(Timeout) ->
  810:     receive M -> M
  811:     after Timeout -> timeout
  812:     end.
  813: 
  814: monitor_nodes_order(_Config) ->
  815:     process_flag(message_queue_data, off_heap),
  816:     erts_debug:set_internal_state(available_internal_state, true),
  817:     true = erts_debug:set_internal_state(proc_sig_buffers, true),
  818: 
  819:     {ok, Peer, RNode} = ?CT_PEER(#{peer_down => continue,
  820:                                    connection => 0}),
  821:     Self = self(),
  822:     ok = net_kernel:monitor_nodes(true, [nodedown_reason]),
  823:     [] = nodes(connected),
  824:     Pids = peer:call(Peer, ?MODULE, spawn_spammers, [64, Self, []]),
  825:     {nodeup, RNode, []} = receive_any(),
  826: 
  827:     ok = peer:cast(Peer, erlang, halt, [0]),
  828: 
  829:     [put(P, 0) || P <- Pids],  % spam counters per sender
  830:     {nodedown, RNode, [{nodedown_reason,connection_closed}]} =
  831:         receive_filter_spam(),
  832:     [io:format("From spammer ~p: ~p messages\n", [P, get(P)]) || P <- Pids],
  833:     timeout = receive_any(100),   % Nothing after nodedown
  834: 
  835:     {down, tcp_closed} = peer:get_state(Peer),
  836:     peer:stop(Peer),
  837:     ok.
  838: 
  839: spawn_spammers(0, _To, Acc) ->
  840:     Acc;
  841: spawn_spammers(N, To, Acc) ->
  842:     Pid = spawn(fun() -> spam_pid(To, 1) end),
  843:     spawn_spammers(N-1, To, [Pid | Acc]).
  844: 
  845: spam_pid(To, N) ->
  846:     To ! {spam, self(), N},
  847:     erlang:yield(), % Let other spammers run to get lots of different senders
  848:     spam_pid(To, N+1).
  849: 
  850: receive_filter_spam() ->
  851:     receive
  852:         {spam, From, N} ->
  853:             match(N, get(From) + 1),
  854:             put(From, N),
  855:             receive_filter_spam();
  856:         M -> M
  857:     end.
  858: 
  859: move_msgs_off_heap_signal_basic(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  860:     move_msgs_off_heap_signal_test(false, false).
  861: 
  862: move_msgs_off_heap_signal_recv(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  863:     move_msgs_off_heap_signal_test(true, false).
  864: 
  865: move_msgs_off_heap_signal_exit(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  866:     move_msgs_off_heap_signal_test(false, true).
  867: 
  868: move_msgs_off_heap_signal_recv_exit(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  869:     move_msgs_off_heap_signal_test(true, true).
  870: 
  871: move_msgs_off_heap_signal_test(RecvPair, Exit) ->
  872:     erlang:trace(new_processes, true, [running_procs]),
  873:     SFact = test_server:timetrap_scale_factor(),
  874:     GoTime = erlang:monotonic_time(millisecond) + 1000*SFact,
  875:     ProcF = fun () ->
  876:                     Now = erlang:monotonic_time(millisecond),
  877:                     Tmo = case GoTime - Now of
  878:                               Left when Left < 0 ->
  879:                                   erlang:display({go_time_passed, Left}),
  880:                                   0;
  881:                               Left ->
  882:                                   Left
  883:                           end,
  884:                     receive after Tmo -> ok end,
  885:                     on_heap = process_flag(message_queue_data, off_heap),
  886:                     if RecvPair -> receive_integer_pairs(infinity);
  887:                        true -> receive after infinity -> ok end
  888:                     end
  889:             end,
  890:     Ps = lists:map(fun (_) ->
  891:                            spawn_opt(ProcF,
  892:                                      [link,
  893:                                       {message_queue_data, on_heap}])
  894:                    end, lists:seq(1, 100)),
  895:     lists:foreach(fun (P) ->
  896:                           lists:foreach(fun (N) when N rem 100 == 0 ->
  897:                                                 P ! [N|N];
  898:                                             (N) ->
  899:                                                 P ! N
  900:                                         end, lists:seq(1, 10000))
  901:                   end, Ps),
  902:     Now = erlang:monotonic_time(millisecond),
  903:     Tmo = case GoTime - Now + 10 of
  904:               Left when Left < 0 ->
  905:                   erlang:display({go_time_passed, Left}),
  906:                   0;
  907:               Left ->
  908:                   Left
  909:           end,
  910:     receive after Tmo -> ok end,
  911:     if Exit ->
  912:             _ = lists:foldl(fun (P, N) when N rem 10 ->
  913:                                     unlink(P),
  914:                                     exit(P, terminated),
  915:                                     N+1;
  916:                                 (_P, N) ->
  917:                                     N+1
  918:                             end,
  919:                             0,
  920:                             Ps),
  921:             ok;
  922:        true ->
  923:             ok
  924:     end,
  925:     wait_traced_not_running(1000 + 200*SFact),
  926:     erlang:trace(new_processes, false, [running_procs]),
  927:     lists:foreach(fun (P) ->
  928:                           unlink(P),
  929:                           exit(P, kill)
  930:                   end, Ps),
  931:     lists:foreach(fun (P) ->
  932:                           false = is_process_alive(P)
  933:                   end, Ps),
  934:     ok.
  935: 
  936: copy_literal_area_signal_basic(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  937:     copy_literal_area_signal_test(false, false).
  938: 
  939: copy_literal_area_signal_recv(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  940:     copy_literal_area_signal_test(true, false).
  941: 
  942: copy_literal_area_signal_exit(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  943:     copy_literal_area_signal_test(false, true).
  944: 
  945: copy_literal_area_signal_recv_exit(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  946:     copy_literal_area_signal_test(true, true).
  947: 
  948: copy_literal_area_signal_test(RecvPair, Exit) ->
  949:     persistent_term:put({?MODULE, ?FUNCTION_NAME}, make_ref()),
  950:     Literal = persistent_term:get({?MODULE, ?FUNCTION_NAME}),
  951:     true = is_reference(Literal),
  952:     0 = erts_debug:size_shared(Literal), %% Should be a literal...
  953:     ProcF = fun () ->
  954:                     0 = erts_debug:size_shared(Literal), %% Should be a literal...
  955:                     if RecvPair ->
  956:                             receive receive_pairs -> ok end,
  957:                             receive_integer_pairs(0);
  958:                        true ->
  959:                             ok
  960:                     end,
  961:                     receive check_literal_conversion -> ok end,
  962:                     receive
  963:                         Literal ->
  964:                             %% Should not be a literal anymore...
  965:                             false = (0 == erts_debug:size_shared(Literal))
  966:                     end
  967:             end,
  968:     PMs = lists:map(fun (_) ->
  969:                             spawn_opt(ProcF, [link, monitor])
  970:                     end, lists:seq(1, 100)),
  971:     lists:foreach(fun ({P,_M}) ->
  972:                           lists:foreach(fun (N) when N rem 100 == 0 ->
  973:                                                 P ! [N|N];
  974:                                             (N) ->
  975:                                                 P ! N
  976:                                         end, lists:seq(1, 10000)),
  977:                           P ! Literal
  978:                   end, PMs),
  979:     persistent_term:erase({?MODULE, ?FUNCTION_NAME}),
  980:     receive after 1 -> ok end,
  981:     if RecvPair ->
  982:             lists:foreach(fun ({P,_M}) ->
  983:                                   P ! receive_pairs
  984:                           end, PMs);
  985:        true ->
  986:             ok
  987:     end,
  988:     if Exit ->
  989:             _ = lists:foldl(fun ({P, _M}, N) when N rem 10 ->
  990:                                     unlink(P),
  991:                                     exit(P, terminated),
  992:                                     N+1;
  993:                                 (_PM, N) ->
  994:                                     N+1
  995:                             end,
  996:                             0,
  997:                             PMs),
  998:             ok;
  999:        true ->
 1000:             ok
 1001:     end,
 1002:     literal_area_collector_test:check_idle(),
 1003:     lists:foreach(fun ({P,_M}) ->
 1004:                           P ! check_literal_conversion
 1005:                   end, PMs),
 1006:     lists:foreach(fun ({P, M}) ->
 1007:                           receive
 1008:                               {'DOWN', M, process, P, R} ->
 1009:                                   case R of
 1010:                                       normal -> ok;
 1011:                                       terminated -> ok
 1012:                                   end
 1013:                           end
 1014:                   end, PMs),
 1015:     ok.
 1016: 
 1017: simultaneous_signals_basic(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1018:     simultaneous_signals_test(false, false).
 1019: 
 1020: simultaneous_signals_recv(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1021:     simultaneous_signals_test(true, false).
 1022: 
 1023: simultaneous_signals_exit(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1024:     simultaneous_signals_test(false, true).
 1025: 
 1026: simultaneous_signals_recv_exit(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1027:     simultaneous_signals_test(true, true).
 1028: 
 1029: simultaneous_signals_test(RecvPairs, Exit) ->
 1030:     erlang:trace(new_processes, true, [running_procs]),
 1031:     persistent_term:put({?MODULE, ?FUNCTION_NAME}, make_ref()),
 1032:     Literal = persistent_term:get({?MODULE, ?FUNCTION_NAME}),
 1033:     true = is_reference(Literal),
 1034:     0 = erts_debug:size_shared(Literal), %% Should be a literal...
 1035:     SFact = test_server:timetrap_scale_factor(),
 1036:     GoTime = erlang:monotonic_time(millisecond) + 1000*SFact,
 1037:     ProcF = fun () ->
 1038:                     0 = erts_debug:size_shared(Literal), %% Should be a literal...
 1039:                     Now = erlang:monotonic_time(millisecond),
 1040:                     Tmo = case GoTime - Now of
 1041:                               Left when Left < 0 ->
 1042:                                   erlang:display({go_time_passed, Left}),
 1043:                                   0;
 1044:                               Left ->
 1045:                                   Left
 1046:                           end,
 1047:                     receive after Tmo -> ok end,
 1048:                     on_heap = process_flag(message_queue_data, off_heap),
 1049:                     if RecvPairs -> receive_integer_pairs(0);
 1050:                        true -> ok
 1051:                     end,
 1052:                     receive check_literal_conversion -> ok end,
 1053:                     receive
 1054:                         Literal ->
 1055:                             %% Should not be a literal anymore...
 1056:                             false = (0 == erts_debug:size_shared(Literal))
 1057:                     end
 1058:             end,
 1059:     PMs = lists:map(fun (_) ->
 1060:                             spawn_opt(ProcF,
 1061:                                       [link,
 1062:                                        monitor,
 1063:                                        {message_queue_data, on_heap}])
 1064:                     end, lists:seq(1, 100)),
 1065:     lists:foreach(fun ({P,_M}) ->
 1066:                           lists:foreach(fun (N) when N rem 100 == 0 ->
 1067:                                                 P ! [N|N];
 1068:                                             (N) ->
 1069:                                                 P ! N
 1070:                                         end, lists:seq(1, 10000)),
 1071:                           P ! Literal
 1072:                   end, PMs),
 1073:     Now = erlang:monotonic_time(millisecond),
 1074:     Tmo = case GoTime - Now - 5 of % a bit earlier...
 1075:               Left when Left < 0 ->
 1076:                   erlang:display({go_time_passed, Left}),
 1077:                   0;
 1078:               Left ->
 1079:                   Left
 1080:           end,
 1081:     receive after Tmo -> ok end,
 1082:     persistent_term:erase({?MODULE, ?FUNCTION_NAME}),
 1083:     receive after 10 -> ok end,
 1084:     if Exit ->
 1085:             _ = lists:foldl(fun ({P, _M}, N) when N rem 10 ->
 1086:                                     unlink(P),
 1087:                                     exit(P, terminated),
 1088:                                     N+1;
 1089:                                 (_PM, N) ->
 1090:                                     N+1
 1091:                             end,
 1092:                             0,
 1093:                             PMs),
 1094:             ok;
 1095:        true ->
 1096:             ok
 1097:     end,
 1098:     wait_traced_not_running(1000 + 200*SFact),
 1099:     erlang:trace(new_processes, false, [running_procs]),
 1100:     literal_area_collector_test:check_idle(),
 1101:     lists:foreach(fun ({P,_M}) ->
 1102:                           P ! check_literal_conversion
 1103:                   end, PMs),
 1104:     lists:foreach(fun ({P, M}) ->
 1105:                           receive
 1106:                               {'DOWN', M, process, P, R} ->
 1107:                                   case R of
 1108:                                       normal -> ok;
 1109:                                       terminated -> ok
 1110:                                   end
 1111:                           end
 1112:                   end, PMs),
 1113:     ok.
 1114:     
 1115: 
 1116: wait_traced_not_running(Tmo) ->
 1117:     receive
 1118:         {trace,_,What,_} when What == in;
 1119:                               What == out ->
 1120:             wait_traced_not_running(Tmo)
 1121:     after
 1122:         Tmo ->
 1123:             ok
 1124:     end.
 1125: 
 1126: receive_integer_pairs(Tmo) ->
 1127:     receive
 1128:         [N|N] ->
 1129:             receive_integer_pairs(Tmo)
 1130:     after
 1131:         Tmo ->
 1132:             ok
 1133:     end.
 1134: 
 1135: %%
 1136: %% -- Internal utils --------------------------------------------------------
 1137: %%
 1138: 
 1139: match(X,X) -> ok.
 1140: 
 1141: load_driver(Config, Driver) ->
 1142:     DataDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
 1143:     case erl_ddll:load_driver(DataDir, Driver) of
 1144:         ok ->
 1145:             ok;
 1146:         {error, Error} = Res ->
 1147:             io:format("~s\n", [erl_ddll:format_error(Error)]),
 1148:             Res
 1149:     end.
 1150: 
 1151: wait_until(Fun) ->
 1152:     case (catch Fun()) of
 1153:         true ->
 1154:             ok;
 1155:         _ ->
 1156:             receive after 1 -> ok end,
 1157:             wait_until(Fun)
 1158:     end.
 1159: 
 1160: find_proc_link(Pid, To) when is_pid(Pid), is_pid(To) ->
 1161:     lists:keyfind(To,
 1162:                   #erl_link.pid,
 1163:                   erts_debug:get_internal_state({link_list, Pid})).
 1164: 
 1165: make_busy(OnNode, ToNode, Time) ->
 1166:     Parent = self(),
 1167:     Fun = fun () ->
 1168:                   Proxy = self(),
 1169:                   Sspndr = spawn_link(
 1170:                              ToNode,
 1171:                              fun () ->
 1172:                                      IC = find_gen_tcp_input_cntrlr(OnNode),
 1173:                                      erlang:suspend_process(IC),
 1174:                                      Proxy ! {self(), input_cntrlr_suspended},
 1175:                                      receive
 1176:                                          {Proxy, resume_input_cntrlr} ->
 1177:                                              erlang:resume_process(IC)
 1178:                                      end,
 1179:                                      Proxy ! {self(), input_cntrlr_resumed}
 1180:                              end),
 1181:                   receive
 1182:                       {Sspndr, input_cntrlr_suspended} ->
 1183:                           ok
 1184:                   end,
 1185:                   Spammer = spawn_link(
 1186:                               OnNode,
 1187:                               fun () ->
 1188:                                       spammed = spam(ToNode),
 1189:                                       Proxy ! {self(), channel_busy},
 1190:                                       receive
 1191:                                       after Time -> ok
 1192:                                       end,
 1193:                                       Proxy ! {self(), timeout}
 1194:                               end),
 1195:                   receive
 1196:                       {Spammer, channel_busy} ->
 1197:                           Parent ! {self(), channel_busy}
 1198:                   end,
 1199:                   receive
 1200:                       {Spammer, timeout} ->
 1201:                           Sspndr ! {self(), resume_input_cntrlr}
 1202:                   end,
 1203:                   receive
 1204:                       {Sspndr, input_cntrlr_resumed} ->
 1205:                           ok
 1206:                   end
 1207:           end,
 1208:     Proxy = spawn_link(Fun),
 1209:     receive
 1210:         {Proxy, channel_busy} ->
 1211:             ok
 1212:     end,
 1213:     Proxy.
 1214: 
 1215: find_gen_tcp_input_cntrlr(Node) when is_atom(Node) ->
 1216:     case lists:keyfind(Node, 1, erlang:system_info(dist_ctrl)) of
 1217:         {Node, DistCtrl} ->
 1218:             find_gen_tcp_input_cntrlr(DistCtrl);
 1219:         false ->
 1220:             undefined
 1221:     end;
 1222: find_gen_tcp_input_cntrlr(DistCtrl) when is_pid(DistCtrl) ->
 1223:     {links, LList} = process_info(DistCtrl, links),
 1224:     try
 1225:         lists:foreach(fun (Pid) ->
 1226:                               case process_info(Pid, initial_call) of
 1227:                                   {initial_call,
 1228:                                    {gen_tcp_dist,dist_cntrlr_input_setup,3}} ->
 1229:                                       throw({input_ctrlr, Pid});
 1230:                                   _ ->
 1231:                                       ok
 1232:                               end
 1233:                       end,
 1234:                       LList),
 1235:         undefined
 1236:     catch
 1237:         throw:{input_ctrlr, DistInputCtrlr} ->
 1238:             DistInputCtrlr
 1239:     end.
 1240: 
 1241: spam(Node) ->
 1242:     To = {'__a_name_hopefully_not_registered__', Node},
 1243:     Data = lists:seq(1, 100),
 1244:     spam(To, Data).
 1245: 
 1246: spam(To, Data) ->
 1247:     case erlang:send(To, Data, [nosuspend]) of
 1248:         nosuspend ->
 1249:             spammed;
 1250:         _ ->
 1251:             spam(To, Data)
 1252:     end.
 1253: 
 1254: repeat(_Fun, N) when is_integer(N), N =< 0 ->
 1255:     ok;
 1256: repeat(Fun, N) when is_function(Fun, 0), is_integer(N)  ->
 1257:     Fun(),
 1258:     repeat(Fun, N-1);
 1259: repeat(Fun, N) when is_function(Fun, 1), is_integer(N)  ->
 1260:     Fun(N),
 1261:     repeat(Fun, N-1).
 1262: 
 1263: busy_wait_until(Fun) ->
 1264:     case catch Fun() of
 1265:         true -> ok;
 1266:         _ -> busy_wait_until(Fun)
 1267:     end.
